markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 7"
    pfs="Restricted"
>
[Bellicose Dagger](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2374)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Cursed" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=274" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 190 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The hilt of a _bellicose dagger_ is etched with the word for “war” in various languages. Having absorbed the spirit of violence over the course of its existence, the weapon now craves bloodshed. A _bellicose dagger_ is a _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [wounding](/Equipment.aspx?ID=309) [dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3)_. However, anytime you interact with creatures, no matter the context, you must succeed at a DC 25 Will save or else find you have, as a reaction, drawn the dagger.

 When you use the _bellicose dagger_ as a weapon for the first time, it fuses to you. While it's in your possession, you take a –2 circumstance penalty to [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) checks and skill checks to avoid fighting, such as [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks to trick your way out of a scuffle or [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) checks to sneak past enemies.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Bellicose Dagger

text: <title level="1" right="Item 7" pfs="Restricted" > Bellicose Dagger Source Treasure Vault pg. 190 1.1 Usage held in 1 hand Bulk L Base Weapon Dagger --- The hilt of a bellicose dagger is etched with the word for “war” in various languages. Having absorbed the spirit of violence over the course of its existence, the weapon now craves bloodshed. A bellicose dagger is a +1 striking wounding dagger . However, anytime you interact with creatures, no matter the context, you must succeed at a DC 25 Will save or else find you have, as a reaction, drawn the dagger. When you use the bellicose dagger as a weapon for the first time, it fuses to you. While it's in your possession, you take a –2 circumstance penalty to Diplomacy checks and skill checks to avoid fighting, such as Deception checks to trick your way out of a scuffle or Stealth checks to sneak past enemies.
